snippet: A former “Canadian Idol” contestant was acquitted Tuesday of conspiring to facilitate terrorism, with Superior Court Justice Charles Hackland finding insufficient evidence that he intended to join a plot.
abstract: Former Canadian Idol contestant Khurram Syed Sher is acquitted of conspiring to facilitate terrorism; judge finds insufficient evidence that he intended to join complex plot that involved sending money to terrorists abroad and scouting targets in Canada.
lead_paragraph: A former “Canadian Idol” contestant was acquitted Tuesday of conspiring to facilitate terrorism, with Superior Court Justice Charles Hackland finding insufficient evidence that he intended to join a plot.

headline.main: Canada: ‘Idol’ Contestant Acquitted of Aiding Terror
headline.print_headline: Canada: ‘Idol’ Contestant Acquitted of Aiding Terror
